comments.content: Prisma is a SAS solution and GlobalProtect is Client to site VPN

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The one that blows my mind is the difference between Prima Saas (formerly Aperture) and the all-points Internet Gateway thingy called "GlobalProtect".
I thought Aperture was the correct answer?

questions.question_text: Which Palo Alto Networks service protects cloud-based applications such as Dropbox and Salesforce by monitoring permissions and shares and scanning files for sensitive information?
In a Security policy, what is the quickest way to reset all policy rule hit counters to zero?

choices.A: Highlight each rule and use the Reset Rule Hit Counter > Selected Rules
choices.D: Use the CLI enter the command reset rules all
choices.C: Use the Reset Rule Hit Counter > All Rules option

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct

questions.question_text:
Based on the Security policy rules shown, SSH will be allowed on which port?
//IMG//

choices.D: same port as ssl and snmpv3

discussion.content: Strongly recommend completing the Security+ or its equivalent in PCCET - Palo Alto Networks Certified Entry-level Technician. As a Firewall Administrator, knowing about 100 ports by heart is essential.

Selected Answer: A
application-default means the default port will be used. in this case for SSH port 22.
A is correct.

choices.D: Vulnerability Protection Profile applied to inbound Security policy rules
choices.A: Data Filtering Profile applied to outbound Security policy rules
choices.C: Data Filtering Profile applied to inbound Security policy rules
choices.B: Antivirus Profile applied to outbound Security policy rules

questions.question_text:
You receive notification about new malware that is being used to attack hosts. The malware exploits a software bug in common application.
Which Security Profile detects and blocks access to this threat after you update the firewall's threat signature database?

discussion.content:
Agree, should be D. See study guide p153:
Vulnerability Protection - Detects attempts to exploit known software vulnerabilities

The correct answer is D. Vulnerability Protection Profile applied to inbound Security policy rules.

Vulnerability Protection Profiles are designed to detect and block attempts to exploit software bugs in common applications. When a new malware is identified and the firewallâ€™s threat signature database is updated, the Vulnerability Protection Profile can detect and block access to this threat. This profile is typically applied to inbound Security policy rules to protect the network from external threats.

Selected Answer: D
Vulnerability Protection profiles stop attempts to exploit system flaws or gain unauthorized access to systems. While Anti-Spyware profiles help identify infected hosts as traffic leaves the network, Vulnerability Protection profiles protect against threats entering th e network. For example, Vulnerability Protection profiles help protect against buffer overflows, illegal code execution, and other attempts to exploit system vulnerabilities.
[Palo Alto Networks]

Selected Answer: D
I would think that D is the most accurate because it can detect and block traffic which uses known vulnererabilies. But AntiVirus could help to avoid downloading the malware itself.. But how the question sounds, it's more likely D what they want to hear.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
the exploit is on a Vulnerability. The issue is whether Palo calls it that or combines it in "antivirus". Looking at the previous comments, it is obvious that Vulnerability is a separate security policy concern.

Selected Answer: D
the exploit is on a Vulnerability. The issue is whether Palo calls it that or combines it in "antivirus". Looking at the previous comments, it is obvious that Vulnerability is a separate security policy concern.

Vulnerability Protection Security Profiles stop attempts to exploit system flaws or gain unauthorized access to systems. Anti-Spyware Security Profiles identify infected hosts as traffic leaves the network, but Vulnerability Protection Security Profiles protect against threats entering the network. 

For example, Vulnerability Protection Security Profiles protect against buffer overflows, illegal code execution, and other attempts to exploit system vulnerabilities 

Correct answer is D 

Ref - PCNSA Study Guide 2022 - P157
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/assets/pdf/datasheets/education/pcnsa-study-guide.pdf
Page 153
Vulnerability Protection - Detects attempts to exploit known software vulnerabilities

Apply a Vulnerability Protection profile to every Security Policy rule that allows traffic to protect against buffer overflows, illegal code execution, and other attempts to exploit client- and server-side vulnerabilities.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/8-1/pan-os-web-interface-help/objects/objects-security-profiles-vulnerability-protection.html
D is Correct
I think it's D, but no one has come to this last question so there are no comments..

Selected Answer: CD
C&D are the corrects.
pag.32 PCNSA study guide

Selected Answer: CD
The very core of Palo's concept.
